<RESUME_START>
STAFF ACCOUNTANT
Professional Profile
To advance in professional and personal experiences within Finance, Tax Accounting and Management To obtain a Staff Accountant position that will enable me to perform my best using my mathematical, numerical, accounting and analytical ability for the betterment of the organization.
Highly proactive professional with 10+ years of experience in accounting and economics.
Eager to achieve highest standard of accounting operations and greatest quality of work.
Outstanding communication (written and spoken), drafting and computer skills.
Strong critical thinking skills.
High Proficiency in all computer applications.
Remarkable skill at organizing work and resolving problems that arise in day to day activities.
In-depth ability to work with difficult clientele in a respectful and courteous manner.
Observant, intuitive and conscientious with great attention to detail.
Deep ability to develop and institute processes and procedures.
Qualifications
Microsoft applications Excellent writing skills Research support Analytical skills
Independent worker Time management Attention to detail
Relevant Experience
Accounting Skills
Operated computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information.
Research
Investigated and analyzed client complaints to identify and resolve issues.
Reporting
Maintained status reports to provide management with updated information for client projects.

TRAINING

Successfully trained staff in all office systems and databases, policies and procedures while focusing on minimizing errors and generating superior results.

property specifics, and other appropriate information.
Create/execute notice of value (NOV) variance reporting through established parameters in PTMS Follow through on acquiring necessary refund(s) for erroneous fund dispersals on tax debts Obtain and assess Assessor Property Record Cards (PRC's) to identify land values on properties exceeding established thresholds Monitor Appeals and Hearing deadlines tracking for compliance.

Perform individual account analysis after each month-end closing.
Complete financial statement reconciliations to verify any outstanding payments, deposits, service fees, and other forms of funds in transit Write and review check requests for account refunds and route checks to appropriate financial institution.
Perform weekly withdrawal calculations to determine account refund or deficit status Provide associate assistance, support, and advice where applicable Prepare and file monthly Sales & Use Tax online.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Wealth Management Associate

Location: Melville, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Marketing, Sales

Description:
AboutA pioneering force in the financial services industry, Equitable Advisors is committed to helping our clients secure their financial futures.If you're an entrepreneurial-minded individual and looking for a rewarding career, we invite you to apply for an opportunity to join one of the top teams in the industry as a Financial Advisor! 
Key ResponsibilitiesCultivate and manage a client base, ensuring plans are up-to-date, and actively seek opportunities to expand clienteleAnalyze client financial information and goals to craft personalized strategiesEmploy a Holistic approach when providing comprehensive recommendations, offering a range of financial products including, but not limited to, investments, life insurance, and annuities
What It Takes to Be an Equitable Advisorsâ€™ Financial ProfessionalA four-year college degreeRequired to attain state life and health licenses, SIE, FINRA Series 7 and 66 exams Results-driven, highly motivated self-starter with integrity and a strong work ethicTeam player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and high self-confidenceAbility to leverage past/present experiences and connections to develop markets and sustain long-term relationshipsApplicants must be authorized to work in the United States
Benefits of Joining UsPersonalized and comprehensive training, mentorship, and support in crucial areas for building your businessCompensation you control with a comprehensive benefits packageSponsorship and coaching for required licenses (FINRA SIE, Series 7, Series 66, & Life and Health Insurance)Opportunities for specialization, from Certified Financial Planner (CFP) professional to various collaboration rolesCollaboration with senior joint-work partners and coaching from top performersAdvancement and management opportunitiesWork-life balance and access to a full suite of remote-work technology solutions
How to Get Started: Apply through LinkedIn or via our Website (Click Here)
As a Financial Professional at Equitable Advisors, we sponsor your pursuit of licensing requirements. Our training curriculum is designed to equip you with the skills and tools needed for a successful career. Our program covers client management, sales skills, market development, product knowledge, technology systems, and core practice management systems. Join us and embark on a rewarding journey where your success is our priority.
Securities offered through Equitable Advisors, LLC (NY, NY (212) 314-4600), member FINRA, SIPC (Equitable Financial Advisors in MI & TN). Investment advisory products and services offered through Equitable Advisors, LLC, an SEC-registered investment advisor. Annuity and insurance products offered through Equitable Network, LLC. Equitable Advisors, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V. AGE-6240212.1(2/24)(Exp.2/26)
Keywords: Series 7, FINRA, SIE, Sales Manager, Insurance Agent, Insurance Sales, Sales, Account Manager, Account Executive, Inside Sales, Outside Sales, Sales Representative, Business Development, Retirement, Financial Advisors

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
